Comment: Completely agree !  As well, I feel like we broke a bunch of things, like limiting the House to 435 seats.  The senate over and under-represents people as a feature, not a bug.  The House is supposed to be where equal representation occurs, but with limiting the seating, we have areas that are over or under represented in the House as well.   The other thing I think we broke was the Electoral College.  In the Federalist papers it describes the purpose of the Electoral College as the method to prevent someone of low-esteem from coming into power if the electorate is fooled into electing them.  The Electoral College was supposed to act as a circuit breaker in that event.  Now it's more or less a formality.   Of course Congress is supposed to limit the President as well.  If the courts find the administration, or the President in contempt, Congress is supposed to act with censure, or impeachment, as the courts can't directly enforce their orders.  I don't think the writers of the constitution foresaw a congress so under the power of any President.   As you say, we depend so much on "handshake" agreements, where everyone will act honorably in the best interests of the country,  and that's the weakness of our government.
